results.title: Want to Improve Your Posture? Physical Therapists Say to Try the Viral "Adult Tummy Time" Trend
results.summary: This article discusses the adult version of "tummy time", a trend popularized on TikTok, and its potential benefits for improving posture and alleviating "tech neck". Physical therapists suggest it can help stretch tight flexor muscles and strengthen spinal extensors. However, the article also warns that tummy time may not be safe for everyone, particularly those with back issues. As Christians, we should strive to maintain our physical health as temples of the Holy Spirit (1 Corinthians 6:19-20), but always seek guidance and wisdom from God (Proverbs 3:5-6) when considering health trends. Consult healthcare professionals and proceed with caution.

results.title: Longevity Lifts: 6 Essential Strength Moves Women In Their 60s Need To Do For Muscle And Bone Health
results.summary: Trainer Patricia Greaves, CPT, highlights six essential strength exercises for women in their 60s to maintain muscle mass, mobility, and bone health. The workout includes Goblet Squats, Bent-Over Rows, Jump Squats, Bird-Dog, Glute Bridge, and Incline Push-Ups, focusing on everyday movements. Though it encourages physical health, it lacks acknowledgement of God's role in health and well-being (1 Corinthians 6:19-20).

results.title: An Alarming Trend: As U.S. Longevity Falls, What Can You Do?
results.summary: Kenneth H. Cooper, M.D., discusses declining U.S. life expectancy and the importance of lifestyle choices for health. He emphasizes personal responsibility, referencing a JAMA article and his own research showing increased longevity and reduced healthcare costs through preventive measures. Cooper also highlights the role of faith, quoting Isaiah 40:31, and encourages readers to improve their health spiritually and physically. The use of the New Living Translation raises concern, as the KJV Bible is preferred.
